desc:
Job Title:Lead Data Analyst
Location:Noida
The purpose of the Barclaycard Risk Strategy team is to drive value through appropriate Risk Management of relevant credit risk analytics and strategies for the portfolios allocated.
Provide advanced presentation methods and tools to manage, negotiate and influence a variety of Senior CRO and commercial stakeholders using knowledge formed from a deep understanding of portfolio’s and segments.
Oversee the production of ad-hoc MI and provide support to the wider CRO teams and senior management/stakeholders.
Production of a range of reports to establish credit performance, specifically to contribute and present to the monthly Risk Management Committee and senior stakeholder meetings – provide recommendations (where appropriate) and influence/negotiate with stakeholders to obtain delivery/sign off.
The role holder will need to mentor junior team members as required
They will also need to drive a culture of continuous improvement and maintain an effective working relationship with stakeholders across functions and locations.
What will you be doing:
Provide best-in-class analytics (50%)
Work closely with your team to provide in-depth monitoring of performance of certain reports/analysis, spotting trends and insights & driving any necessary corrective actions
Liaising with key internal and external stakeholders (specifically Chief Credit Officer and Head of Commercial teams) to ensure analysis/context is complete.
On-going monitoring of performance.
Ensure MI, Insight and commentary is accurate, timely and that any changes required by senior management are also delivered.
Be creative in your approach to data analysis / performance mgt, obtaining insights in different ways and demonstrating expertise to provide new ways of managing portfolio risk. Constantly assess the team’s performance, looking for continual improvements
Respond to requests for information from senior management. Producing timely, clear and accurate data/insight to meet those requests.
Stakeholder Management and Leadership (20%)
The key stakeholders of this role will be
The other members of the CRO team
Collections, Fraud and other Operations teams
The Commercial team
Strategic Analytics team
Finance
Risk & Governance
The person will need to work effectively with colleagues across these stakeholders to achieve shared business objectives. This includes sharing analytical insights, and presenting / defending these conclusions in appropriate formal and informal forums.
Mentoring (10%):
Develop a high performing team through support / challenge / direction of junior team members
Engage and motivate junior team members towards achieving goals.
Improve Internal Processes (10%)
Identify new opportunities for enhancing/ streamlining services
Formulate opportunities into proposals, share with the manager and implement
Team Player Activities (10%):
Work effectively with peers and management team to achieve shared business objectives
Contribute to the wider colleague agenda of the Barclaycard Risk Strategy India Hub
What we’re looking for:
Business Skills- Strong business acumen and understanding of consumer lending business specially in unsecured lending domain
Reporting Skills- Use tools such as Microsoft PowerPoint to transform data in to visually appealing reports which is easy to grasp
Communication – Effectively and concisely communicate key issues and ideas through correspondences and verbally. Interface with seniors effectively. Interface with various departments effectively to ensure project delivery.
Commercial skills -Create and implement project task plans to accomplish business plan objectives.
Conceptual thinking - Strong strategic thinker with good intellect and ability to focus on different parts of the portfolio and their associated value generation. Strong project management skills with the ability to adapt to several projects simultaneously.
Team work – Commitment and ability to work with, and in, cross-functional and virtual teams – coupled with ability for straight talking.
Analytical skills – Ability to problem solve and translate data into relevant risk and business information.
Innovation – Create appealing and innovative product concepts and communications. Ability to evaluate risk management concepts and communications.
Value based business perspective - the ability to be able to analyse the portfolio on a value basis, understanding both high level results and key value drivers.
A degree in an analytical/business related discipline
Ability to generate insights from data, assess the commercial / financial impact and recommend action
Extensive experience analysing programmes through the lens of risk management
Understanding of statistical methods to enable appropriate interpretation of results
Comprehensive knowledge and effective use of analytical tools including SQL and SAS.
Proficient in Microsoft PowerPoint , Word and Excel
Familiarity with risk reporting and risk management models.
Familiarity with segmentation tools and strategies.
Conceptual thinking – find innovative ways to solve analytical problems
Ability to deliver accurate results within tight deadlines
Team work – Commitment and ability to work with cross-functional teams
Strong interpersonal skills
Excellent Oral and written communication skills with ability to translate insight into a coherent story
Effective stakeholder management skills
Leadership skills
Experienced in delivering complex projects through effective stakeholder management
Skills that will help you in the role:
Post-graduate degree
Extensive experience analysing programmes through the lens of Cards P&L and customer metrics.
Industry knowledge (ideally experience with major international financial services firm)
Where will you be working?
Noida
